Description: Fragment of lip, neck and double handle of a Koan pottery transport amphora. Clay fine light buff-brown. Ovoid stamp. Sampled.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir Charles Thomas Newton (?)
Curator's comments: There is no recorded example of a similar abbreviation of the name Simalion, known from other Koan stamps, and from Alexandria..
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir Charles Thomas Newton (?)
Acquisition date: 1856-1859 (This piece cannot be assigned definitely to Petrie or Newton; the latter is probably more likely)
